trial_identification.studytitle: Cerebral Palsy Hip Outcomes Project - International Multi-centre Study
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Outcomes of Hip Interventions for Children With Cerebral Palsy - An International Multi-centre Prospective Comparative Cohort Study

interventions.interventions:
A. "Natural" History or Watchful Waiting -
B. Serial Botulinum Toxin Injections +/- Abduction Bracing -
C. Adductor (+/- psoas) Muscle Releases Alone -
D. Hip Reconstructive Surgery -
E. Salvage Hip Surgery -

primaryOutcome.outcome: CPCHILD questionnaire: Total Score (0-100) - The primary outcome measure will be based at the 12 month assessment. The CPCHILD questionnaire is a validated outcome measure of health-related quality of life specifically developed for children with severe, non-ambulant cerebral palsy (GMFCS level IV and V) to evaluate the effectiveness of different treatment options.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Change from baseline to 12 months after treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: CPCHILD Questionnaire: Total Score (0-100) - The CPCHILD questionnaire is a validated outcome measure of health-related quality of life specifically developed for children with severe, non-ambulant cerebral palsy (GMFCS level IV and V) to evaluate the effectiveness of different treatment options.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Change from baseline to 24 months after treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Reimer's Migration Percentage (MP) - The Reimer's Migration Percentage (MP) quantifies the magnitude of the displacement of the femoral head that is uncovered by the acetabulum.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Change from baseline to 24 months after treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Acetabular Index (AI) in degrees - The Acetabular Index (AI) in degrees quantifies the magnitude of acetabular dysplasia.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Change from baseline to 24 months after treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Morphological Hip Classification in Cerebral Palsy (MHC) - The Morphological Hip Classification in Cerebral Palsy (MHC) describes the sphericity of the femoral head.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Change from baseline to 24 months after treatment
Change from baseline to 24 months after treatment

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Children with a working diagnosis of cerebral palsy or cerebral palsy-like condition
- Between 2 to 18 years of age
- Has a migration percentage = 30%
- Non-ambulatory; the primary mode of mobility is a wheelchair
- Parent/primary caregiver must understand one of the languages in which the CPCHILD has been translated, culturally adapted and validated.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- History of prior hip surgery
- Received botulinum toxin injection within the previous 3 months. Recruitment will be delayed until at least 3 months after prior botulinum toxin injection.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The primary purpose of the project is to evaluate the effectiveness of different intervention strategies to prevent or relieve symptoms associated with hip instability in children with severe cerebral palsy, using the validated Caregiver Priorities and Child Health Index of Life with Disabilities (CPCHILD©) questionnaire as the primary outcome measure of health-related quality of life for this population.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Narayanan UG, Fehlings D, Weir S, Knights S, Kiran S, Campbell K. Initial development and validation of the Caregiver Priorities and Child Health Index of Life with Disabilities (CPCHILD). Dev Med Child Neurol. 2006 Oct;48(10):804-12.
